trips.name: Adventure Maharashtra 5 Days Trek
highlights: Jivdhan Fort Trek - Historical Sahyadri Fort
Reverse Waterfall at Naneghat - Nature's Wonder
Bhairavgad Fort - Thrilling Vertical Rock Patches
Ratangad Fort - Views of Kalsubai Peak
itinerary: Day 1 (18th/25th Sept): Evening 4:00 PM departure from Bengaluru. Overnight journey to Pune/Satara by train/tempo traveller. Bonding & ice-breaking sessions.
Day 2 (19th/26th Sept): Early arrival in Pune/Satara. Road transfer (~4h) to trek base. Jivdhan Fort Trek (8km, 4+4, Moderate difficulty). Visit Reverse Waterfall near Naneghat. Tent/dorm stay.
Day 3 (20th/27th Sept): Bhairavgad Fort Trek (12km, 6+6, Difficult). Thrilling vertical rock patches and exposed ridges with safety precautions. Expert trek leaders guidance.

Day 4 (21st/28th Sept): Ratangad Fort Trek (12km, 6+6, Moderate). Views of Kalsubai Peak and Bhandardara region. Explore Nedhe, caves and scenic landscapes. Sandan Valley exploration with rappelling and boulder hopping. Evening departure from Nasik.
Day 5 (22nd/29th Sept): Morning arrival in Bengaluru with unforgettable memories of Maharashtra's adventurous trails.
safety: Experienced trek leaders with safety certification
Basic first-aid support and emergency response
All safety precautions for vertical rock climbing

guide.name: Expert Sahyadri Trek Team
guide.experience: Specialized in Maharashtra fort treks and adventure activities
guide.bio: Professional team with extensive experience in Sahyadri mountain range, fort trekking, and adventure sports including rappelling and rock climbing.

includes: Accommodation: Tent stay / dormitory / shared room
Transportation: Train / tempo traveller / mini bus / bus (as per group size)
Experienced trek leaders & basic first-aid support

trips.name: Maharashtra Waterfall Edition (5 Days)
itinerary: Day 1: Evening 6:00 PM departure from Bengaluru to Pune/Satara (Overnight travel)
Day 2: Reach Pune/Satara early morning. Transfers (~4h) to waterfall bases: Nanemachi, Satsada, Shevate (Trek 2+2 km, Difficulty: Easy)
Day 3: Devkund, Kumbhe & Secret Waterfall (Entry self) (Trek 6+6 km, Difficulty: Easy to Moderate). Evening long transfer (~6h) to next base.
Day 4: Kalu Waterfall Trek (4+4 km). Afternoon journey back to Pune. Night departure to Bengaluru.
Day 5: Evening arrival back in Bengaluru

guide.name: Lead Trek Team
guide.bio: Experienced in coordinating waterfall & monsoon treks.

trips.name: Dudhsagar Trek (2 Nights / 3 Days)
itinerary: Day 1: Afternoon 3:00 PM train departure from Bengaluru to Kulem, Goa (Overnight journey)
Day 2: Early arrival, freshen up, breakfast, start Dudhsagar trek 7:00 AM (10+10 km, Moderate). Evening rest.
Night: 12:30 AM return train journey to Bengaluru.
Day 3: Afternoon ~12:30 PM arrival in Bengaluru

guide.name: Regional Trek Lead
guide.bio: Focused on safe monsoon route management.

trips.name: Explore Maharashtra (7 Days)
itinerary: Day 1: Evening 6:00 PM departure from Bengaluru to Pune (Overnight)
Day 2: Early arrival Pune/Satara - Savlya Ghat & Kumbhe Waterfall (2+2 km, Easy)
Day 3: Devkund, Nanemachi, Satsada, Shevate Waterfalls (6+6 km, Easy to Moderate)
Day 4: Rajmachi Fort (Jeep self) & Bhimashankar Temple
Day 5: Kalu Waterfall & Adra Jungle Trek (4+4 km, Easy to Moderate)
Day 6: Bhandardara Reverse, Vasundhara, Necklace Waterfalls + Gondeshwara Temple + Sandan Valley View Point
Day 7: Trimbakeshwar Temple & Durgewadi Waterfall. Evening departure from Nasik to Bengaluru.
Day 8: Morning/Day arrival in Bengaluru

guide.name: Senior Trek Captain
guide.bio: Expert in logistics across multi-region routes.

trips.name: Kumbhe Waterfall Rappelling – 5 Days Adventure
itinerary: Day 1: 4:30 AM departure from Bengaluru by train to Pune. Journey begins with scenic landscape transformation.
Day 2: Morning arrival in Pune. Transfer to Kumbhe Waterfall. Safety briefing and rappelling adventure begins. Evening campfire and overnight stay.
Day 3: Waterfall exploration day - Nanemachi (crystal turquoise), Satsada (seven cascades), Shevate (pristine gem). Trek: 2+2 km easy trail.
Day 4: Early trek to iconic Devkund Waterfall from Bhira village. 6+6 km moderate trek through forests and meadows. Night train return.
Day 5: 11:30 AM arrival back in Bengaluru with unforgettable memories.
essentials: Hard cash (limited ATMs in remote areas)
Energy snacks: chocolates, glucose, dry fruits, ORS

guide.name: Adventure Sports Team
guide.experience: 5+ years in waterfall rappelling and Maharashtra treks
guide.bio: Specialized team of certified rappelling instructors and trek leaders with extensive experience in Maharashtra's waterfalls and adventure sports.

includes: Accommodation: Tent stay / Dormitory stay / Shared rooms
Transportation: Tempo Traveller / Mini Bus / Bus / Train
Professional rappelling equipment and safety gear
excludes: Off-road vehicle or extra transport charges
